Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அன்பிலார் எல்லாம் தமக்குரியர் அன்புடையார்என்பும் உரியர் பிறர்க்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Those who are destitute of love appropriate all they have to themselves; but those who possess love consider even their bones to belong to others.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. On the left, a loveless person ('அன்பிலார்') is shown hoarding possessions, clutching them tightly. Their body is slowly turning to cold, hard stone, symbolizing their self-containment.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a loving person ('அன்புடையார்') is shown freely giving to others. Their physical body is depicted as becoming translucent and ethereal, revealing their glowing bones ('என்பும் உரியர்'), signifying ultimate selflessness.
Layered_Composition.Background: The background for the loveless person is a dark, closed vault. The background for the loving person is an open, sunlit field, with the gifts they give blossoming into flowers.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The fundamental difference between the loveless, who claim everything for themselves, and the loving, who would give away even their very bones for the sake of others.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The transformation into stone represents the death of the spirit in selfishness. The translucent body and glowing bones represent the highest form of charity and the liberation of the spirit.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Stark contrast, selfishness vs. selflessness, coldness vs. warmth.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left side is dark, shadowy, and monochromatic. The right side is filled with a warm, radiant, golden light, emanating from the loving person's glowing form.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Wide shot, using a clear dividing line to emphasize the stark contrast between the two figures.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with strong textural contrast between stone and ethereal light.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dualistic lighting scheme: harsh, cold light on the left; soft, warm, internal light on the right.
